properties.title: Lake and River Ice Database Update
properties.description: The Global Lake and River Ice Phenology database has seasonal freeze-up and breakup dates as well as other descriptive ice information for 865 lakes and rivers in twelve Northern Hemisphere countries.

properties.title: The World's Glaciers, Inventoried
properties.description: In cooperation with the World Glacier Monitoring Service (WGMS), NOAA@NSIDC has released an updated version of the World Glacier Inventory (WGI).

properties.title: Adopt a Glacier
properties.description: To help promote awareness of glacier recession and to support the Roger G. Barry Resource Office for Cryospheric Studies (ROCS), ROCS has created an Adopt-a-Glacier fundraising project.

properties.title: Find Arctic Ocean Data from Submarines at the SCICEX site
properties.description: The SCICEX Web site has been improved. The new site includes links to data access locations, science meeting notes and presentations, and history and background of the program.

properties.title: Sea Ice Thickness and Draft Statistics Data Available
properties.description: The Sea-ice Thickness and Draft Statistics from Submarine ULS, Moored ULS, and a Coupled Model is now available from NSIDC.

properties.title: WCRP in Denver
properties.description: The World Climate Research Program's (WCRP) Open Science Conference took place in Denver on October 24-28.

properties.title: Operational Ice Services Meet, Issue Press Release
properties.description: The International Ice Charting Working Group's 12th meeting was hosted by the British Antarctic survey October 17-21.

properties.title: New NOAA Climate Data Record of Sea Ice Concentration Provides Full Data Transparency and Improved Quality Assessment
properties.description: In cooperation with NOAA's National Climatic Data Center (NCDC) Climate Data Record (CDR) program, NSIDC has released a CDR of sea ice concentration that has full data transparency.

properties.title: Historical IPY Data Catalog Now Available
properties.description: NOAA@NSIDC and the Roger G. Barry Resource Office for Cryospheric Studies (ROCS) are pleased to announce the launch of the ROCS Archives Catalog; and with this, the completion of the International Polar Year Historical Data and Literature project - formerly known as DAHLI.

properties.title: Sea Ice Thickness Field Measurements Available
properties.description: In cooperation with IARC at the University of Alaska, NOAA@NSIDC is providing an access point and standard metadata for the Sea Ice Experiment: Dynamic Nature of the Arctic (SEDNA) project.

properties.title: NOAA Arctic Report Card Workshop Plans Ahead
properties.description: The Arctic Report Card gives a yearly summary of environmental conditions.

properties.title: A Talk On Sea Ice Climate Data Records at the American Association of Geographers Meeting
properties.description: NOAA team lead Florence Fetterer works with Dr. Walt Meier and others at NSIDC to develop a climate data record for sea ice that meets the criteria set forth by the National Research Council.

properties.title: At the Polar Science Center (PSC), University of Washington Applied Physics Laboratory
properties.description: While in Seattle for Association of American Geographers (AAG), Florence Fetterer visited the Polar Science Center (PSC) at the University of Washington Applied Physics Laboratory.

properties.title: NSIDC's Computing Center Shutting Down for Five Days to Become More Green
properties.description: The National Snow and Ice Data Center, through a grant from the National Science Foundation, is modifying its facility to become one of the most energy-efficient data centers in the United States.

properties.title: Workshop on Passive Microwave Sea Ice Products â€“ the Backbone of Long Term Ice Monitoring
properties.description: The World Climate Research Program (WCRP) Climate and Cryosphere (CliC) Project Office sponsored a Satellite-derived Sea Ice Products Community Workshop at NASA Goddard Space Flight Center, Greenbelt, MD, 15-16 March, 2011.

properties.title: March 11, 2011: New Photos Added to the Glacier Photo Collection
properties.description: Photographs of glaciers in the McMurdo Dry Valleys region of Antarctica have been added to the Glacier Photo Collection.

properties.title: March 11, 2011: NOAA@NSIDC Team Member Attends Meeting about Finding Sea Surface Temperature Near the Sea Ice Edge
properties.description: NOAA, the European Space Agency, NASA, and several other agencies sponsor the Group for High Resolution Sea Surface Temperature (GHRSST) to work on improving the quality, timeliness, and accessibility of sea surface temperature (SST) fields.

properties.title: March 8, 2011: New Permafrost Data Set and Associated Education Activity Published
properties.description: A new data set called Soil Temperature Station Data from Permafrost Regions of Russia (Selection of Five Stations), 1880s - 2000 has been published along with an educational classroom activity for K-12 students and teachers.

properties.title: February 25 2011: NOAA@NSIDC Team Member Attends SCICEX SAC Meeting
properties.description: NOAA@NSIDC project manager, Ann Windnagel, attended the SCICEX Science Advisory Committee (SAC) meeting that took place January 26 - 28, 2011 in Washington D.C.

properties.title: Decmber 21 2010: A Better Daily Ice Edge: MASIE-NH Released
properties.description: NSIDC and the U.S. National Ice Center (NIC) are pleased to announce a new daily sea ice analysis product: The Multisensor Analyzed Sea Ice Extent - Northern Hemisphere (MASIE-NH).

properties.title: Decmber 13 2010: IICWG Meeting Presentations Available
properties.description: Documents and presentations from the 11th meeting of the International Ice Charting Working Group (IICWG) are available from the IICWG Meetings Web page.

properties.title: November 02 2010: NOAA Team Member Gave Talk at GSA
properties.description: NOAA@NSIDC project manager Lisa Ballagh gave an invited talk at the Geological Society of America (GSA) meeting in Denver.

properties.title: November 01 2010: The Google Earth Blog featured the Sea ice Index
properties.description: The NSIDC Sea Ice Index was featured in Google Earth's Blog: The Amazing Things About Google Earth.

properties.title: October 26 2010: NOAA@NSIDC Team Lead Gave Talk at IICWG Meeting XI
properties.description: At the IICWG Science Day on October 26, NOAA@NSIDC lead Florence Fetterer spoke on NOAA's Arctic Sea Ice Forecasting Activities, Research, and Priorities.

properties.title: October 25 2010: IICWG News Release
properties.description: The International Ice Chart Working Group (IICWG) concluded a successful 11th meeting the week of October 18 in Washington DC. The group discussed ice modelling and forecasting.

properties.title: September 09 2010: Barnes Ice Cap South Dome Data Set Published
properties.description: NOAA@NSIDC has published a new data set that provides measurements of mass balance, surface velocity, and surface elevation of the South Dome of Barnes Ice Cap.

properties.title: August 26 2010: Borehole Inventory Data Set Published
properties.description: NOAA@NISDC has published a new data set that is an inventory of a network of boreholes equipped for long-term permafrost temperature observations.

properties.title: August 06 2010: Arctic Marine Transportation Program Data Set Published
properties.description: NOAA@NSIDC has published a new data set relevant to developing year-round transportation capabilities in the Arctic Ocean: Arctic Marine Transportation Program 1979-1986.

properties.title: July 21 2010: SCICEX Data Inventory Now Available
properties.description: NOAA@NSIDC has developed and will maintain a data inventory for the Science Ice Exercise (SCICEX) program.

properties.title: May 13 2010: 500 New Photos Added to the NSIDC Glacier Photograph Collection
properties.description: The NOAA@NSIDC team has just added 500 glacier photographs to the NSIDC Glacier Photograph Collection that were taken from space.

properties.title: May 11 2010: Glacier Photo Collection Interface Now Delivers Metadata with Photo Orders
properties.description: Now, when you pick up your high-resolution photo orders from the FTP site, a metadata file in ASCII text format (.txt) is provided with each photograph.

properties.title: April 20 2010: NOAA Data Sets Featured in TakePart.com Article
properties.description: Defense and intelligence services data were featured in the TakePart.com article, "Global Warming: The Military's Other Enemy."

properties.title: April 15 2010: New Look for NOAA@NISDC Web Site
properties.description: NOAA@NISDC's Web site has been redesigned.

properties.title: February 15 2010: SCICEX Jump Page Now Live
properties.description: A new Web page has been developed and launched highlighting the efforts of NOAA@NSIDC on the Science Ice Exercise (SCICEX) program.

properties.title: January 21 2010: New Google Earth KML File Published
properties.description: In collaboration with the University of Colorado at Boulder School of Education, NSDIC has created and released a new Google Earth movie called A Climate Change Tour of Cold Places.

properties.title: January 13 2010: NOAA at AGU
properties.description: NOAA at NSIDC presented several demos and a poster at the Fall 2009 AGU.

properties.title: January 13 2010: Featured Article in NOAA's Climate Watch Magazine
properties.description: Short-term Cooling on a Warming Planet, the featured article for December 31, 2009 in NOAAâ€™s Climate Watch Magazine, was authored by NSIDCâ€™s Michon Scott.

properties.title: November 30 2009: ROCS Hosts a Meeting of the Managers of Campus Cultural Collections
properties.description: On 16 November 2009, ROCS hosted a meeting of the managers of Campus Cultural Collections to discuss an emergency action plan for the special materials held in the NSIDC archives.

properties.title: October 29 2009: Glacier Photograph Collection is the Featured NSIDC Monthly Highlight for October
properties.description: Every month, NSIDC features a data set or important program at NSIDC. For October, the Glacier Photograph Collection is featured.

properties.title: October 29 2009: Members of the NOAA@NSIDC Team Attend SCICEX Science Advisory Committee Meeting
properties.description: Florence Fetterer, NOAA at NSIDC program manager, and Ann Windnagel, NOAA at NSIDC team member, attended the Science Ice Exercise (SCICEX) Science Advisory Committee meeting on October 5th and 6th in Washington, DC.

properties.title: October 22 2009: Canadian Ice Services Arctic Sea Ice Charts Available
properties.description: NOAA at NSIDC has released the Canadian Ice Service Arctic Regional Sea Ice Charts in SIGRID-3 Format data set.

properties.title: October 19 2009: IICWG Stresses Importance of Operational Ice Services
properties.description: The International Ice Charting Working Group (IICWG) issued a news release that highlights the growing importance of operational ice services as Arctic ship traffic increases.

properties.title: September 09 2009: Dutch Magazine Interviews NSIDC Archivist
properties.description: In August, Dutch magazine, Change, interviewed Allaina Wallace, NSIDC Analog Archivist and Glacier Photograph Collection curator.

properties.title: August 06 2009: Ice Station Alpha DVD Released
properties.description: A film documenting the activities that occurred on Drifting Station Alpha in the Arctic Ocean during the International Geophysical Year, 1957 to 1958, has been released.

properties.title: July 21 2009: Glacier Photograph Collection Search and Order Interface Redesign
properties.description: The Glacier Photograph Collection has a new Search and Order Web interface. A complete redesign of the old interface has been implemented as well changes to the overall appearance of the Web site.

properties.title: July 15 2009: High-Resolution Imagery of Sea Ice Data Available from USGS
properties.description: Sea ice images are among the first of the classified, 1-meter resolution visible band images to be publicly released by the USGS Global Fuducial Library.

properties.title: June 16 2009: New Data Set Released
properties.description: NOAA@NSIDC is pleased to announce the release of a new data set: Recurring Spring Leads and Landfast Ice in the Beaufort and Chukchi Seas, 1993-2004.

properties.title: June 10 2009: Updates to the World Glacier Inventory
properties.description: Information and statistics on 157 glaciers from the Huasco Catchment in Chile have been added to the World Glacier Inventory.

properties.title: April 22 2009: NOAA Preserve America Initiative Grant (PAIG) awarded to NOAA@NSIDC
properties.description: NSIDC has been awarded a $12,000 grant to arrange, describe, preserve, digitize, and make available the records of the World Data Center (WDC) for Glaciology at NSIDC.

properties.title: March 20 2009: The Sea Ice Index Has a New Look
properties.description: The redesigned Sea Ice Index Web site makes it easy to see monthly and daily sea ice conditions at a glance.

properties.title: February 20 2009: NSIDC Images in Google Earth 5.0
properties.description: Images from the NSIDC Glacier Photograph Collection and Sea Ice Index have been included in Google Earth 5.0.

properties.title: December 30 2008: The Arctic Observing Network (AON) at the American Geophysical Union Fall Meeting
properties.description: The AON is a collection of more than 30 projects studying Arctic ecosystems, oceans, and ice.

properties.title: December 2 2008: AIDJEX Documentary Film Available on DVD
properties.description: This documentary describes a pilot study conducted in 1972 in preparation for the Arctic Ice Dynamics Joint Experiment's (AIDJEX) main experiment from 1975 to 1976.

properties.title: December 1 2008: Presentation at the American Geophysical Union Meeting in San Francisco
properties.description: Lisa Ballagh, NOAA at NSIDC project manager, is giving a talk at AGU titled "Mapping Glacier Data and Photographs via GeoServer and Virtual Globes."  The talk is in the IN02 "Virtual Globes at AGU" session at 2:25 p.m. on Thursday, December 18, MC 3014.  We welcome feedback on our NOAA-related products and Web pages.

properties.title: December 2008: Glacier Photo Collection Doubles in Size
properties.description: The online NSIDC Glacier Photograph Collection has doubled in size since January 2008, with more than 10,000 high-resolution photographs of glaciers worldwide.

properties.title: November 2008: U.S.-Russia Environmental Data Exchange Workshop
properties.description: NOAA Liaison Florence Fetterer and WDC for Glaciology, Boulder, Director Roger Barry took part in the U.S.-Russia environmental data exchange workshop under the NOAA-Rosydromet MoU, held at the All Russian Institute for Hydrometeorological Information (RIHMI) in Obninsk, Russia. Alex Sterin at left, with Florence Fetterer, Steve Worley, and Karsten Shein in Red Square.

properties.title: October 2008: Summary of the Scientific Applications with Google Earth Conference
properties.description: Lisa Ballagh, from NSIDC, and John Bailey, from the Alaska Supercomputing Facility, co-led the Climate Change working group session at the Summary of the Scientific Applications with Google Earth Conference, Ann Arbor, MI, Oct 22-23.

properties.title: September 2008: World Glacier Inventory Workshop
properties.description: Bruce Raup and Roger Barry of NSIDC attended a Workshop on the World Glacier Inventory, organized by the International Glaciological Society in Lanzhou, China, Sep 21-24.

properties.title: August 2008: New Melt Pond Data Set
properties.description: The Arctic Sea Ice Melt Pond Statistics and Maps, 1999, 2000, and 2001 data set is now available. This data set consists of tables of pond coverage and size statistics for 500 m square cells within 10 km square images along with the surface type maps from which the pond statistics were derived. One-meter surface type maps with either two (water and ice) or three (pond, open water, and ice) classes were created using supervised maximum likelihood classification of high-resolution visible band imagery.

properties.title: July 1, 2008: The Annual State of the Climate Report
properties.description: This report from the American Meteorological Society is now available. Chapter 5, The Poles, summarizes the the 2007 climate of Antarctica and the Arctic relative to years past. This report is translated into other languages and distributed to all 187 World Meteorological Organization member nations. The State of the Climate Report seeks to report on as many of the essential climate variables as possible as identified by GCOS Second Adequacy Report.

properties.title: July 2008: Russian Arctic Sea Ice, 1933-2006
properties.description: The Sea Ice Edge Location and Extent in the Russian Arctic, 1933-2006 data set is now available. The data are derived from sea ice charts from the Arctic and Antarctic Research Institute (AARI), St. Petersburg, Russia. The data set consists of edge locations and monthly and seasonal mean sea ice extents for each of the marginal seas in the Russian Arctic.

properties.title: June 2008: World Glacier Monitoring Service Visitor
properties.description: Michael Zemp, from the World Glacier Monitoring Service in Zurich, Switzerland, is visiting NSIDC for two months. Michael will help us improve the quality of the records in the World Glacier Inventory.

properties.title: June 2008: Daily Plots of Sea Ice Extent Now Available
properties.description: Daily plots of sea ice extent are now available from the Sea Ice Index Web site.

properties.title: April 2008: Glacier Photograph Updates from Peru, the IGY and the NPS Glacier Survey Reports
properties.description: Over 79 glacier photos from Peru taken in the 1950s by Fred D. Ayres have been added to the Glacier Photograph Collection in addition to National Park Service glacier survey reports from 1932-1952 and photographs taken during the International Geophysical Year.

properties.title: April 2008: New Temperature and Precipitation Data Set from Central Asia
properties.description: This data set expands the NOAA Global Historical Climate Network (GHCN) of quality controlled meteorological records.  Records are from 298 stations in Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, and Uzbekistan.  Data were subjected to rigorous quality control and homogeneity assessment procedures, consistent with those used for the GHCN.

properties.title: January 2008: New Teacher Resource
properties.description: The Sea Ice Index is the basis of a new module in Windows to the Universe.

properties.title: December 2007: Analog Archives awarded NEH grant
properties.description: The National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) has awarded the Analog Archives collection a Preservation Assistance Grant for Smaller Institutions.

properties.title: December 2007: Over 34,000 glaciers in China have been added to the World Glacier Inventory
properties.description: The World Glacier Inventory has been updated with over 34,000 new glaciers. For more information, please see the "Quality Assessment and History of Updates" section of the data set documentation for further details about this update. To access the new data from this update, proceed to this Web page and select "CAREERI, Lanzhou, China. Che/Wu" from the Data Contributor pull-down menu.

properties.title: November 2007: Sea Ice Charts of the Russian Arctic in Gridded Format, 1933-2006 (new data set published)
properties.description: The Sea Ice Charts of the Russian Arctic in Gridded Format, 1933-2006, were published. These data, from the Arctic and Antarctic Research Institute in St. Petersburg, Russia, are an important new data source for those studying the role of sea ice in climate change.

properties.title: October 2007: Sea Ice Index Graphics and Numbers
properties.description: Sea Ice Index graphics and numbers figured prominently in coverage of this year's record sea ice extent minimum. The Index Web site had more than 135,000 hits from more than 9,000 distinct users in the month of September alone.

properties.title: October 2007: The Arctic Ice Dynamics Joint Experiment (AIDJEX)
properties.description: AIDJEX was a pioneering experiment that in the mid 1970s provided answers to emerging questions about how sea ice moves and changes in response to the influence of ocean and atmosphere.  See the new AIDJEX page for links to a photo gallery, related material, and to a new retrospective on the experiment by Norbert Untersteiner, AIDJEX Project Director, 1971-1977.

properties.title: September 2007: Sea Ice Index Site Redesigned and GIS Files Available
properties.description: The Sea Ice Index pages have been redesigned so that graphs and images are easier to find. Thumbnails now take users to the Web Image Spreadsheet Tool (WIST), where one can quickly compare images from different time periods. GIS compatible files (shapefiles) of monthly ice coverage are now available as well.

properties.title: September 2007: Sea ice added to Science on a Sphere
properties.description: Sea ice animations now available in the data set catalog of NOAA's Science On a Sphere. Animations of sea ice concentration show the annual cycle and give some idea of its variability, while a series of September monthly means from 1987 on highlights the change in the annual Arctic minimum sea ice extent through time.

properties.title: September 2007: More Online Glacier Photos
properties.description: Today's update to the online collection includes 50 photographs taken between 1890 and 1996. Represented in this batch are Colorado glacier photographs taken by Junius Henderson, Oscar A. Randolph, Rudolph Johnson, and Russell Allen. The glaciers are Andrews, Arapaho, Fair, Isabel, Mills, Saint Vrain and Taylor. Other photos include a series of Franz Josef Glacier (1951 - 1964) and Harry Fielding Reid images of John Muir's cabin taken in 1890.

properties.title: September 2007: Browse Sea Ice Climatologies More Easily
properties.description: National Ice Center Arctic Sea Ice Charts and Climatologies in Gridded Format (http://nsidc.org/data/g02172.html) can now be easily browsed. Using a using a Web Image Spreadsheet Tool (WIST), one can quickly compare (visually) different time periods and products. Click on Browse Images at the top of the product site to see how it works. Use the drop down menus to change the number of rows and columns, and the chart products and time period being displayed.

properties.title: September 2007: Updates to the Online Glacier Photograph Database
properties.description: More than 1,200 photographs of Greenland glaciers have been digitized from slides and are available online for viewing and downloading. The photographs of western Greenland glaciers were taken between 1969 and 1980, from ground observation stations and from U.S. Coast Guard helicopters at an altitude between 100 and 1,000 feet. For further details about this data set please see the data documentation. To access the new data from this update, proceed to this Web page and select "Country" from the available search options. On the next screen choose "Greenland (DK)" from the Country pull-down menu.

properties.title: August 2007: Updates to the World Glacier Inventory
properties.description: The World Glacier Inventory has recently been updated. Over 1,600 glaciers from the former Soviet Union were added and errors with 368 glacier IDs were identified and corrected. For more information, please see the Quality Assessment and History of Updates section of our documentation for further details about these updates. To access the new data from this update, proceed to this Web page and select "Institute of Geography, Russian Academy of Science. Chernova" from the Data Contributor pull-down menu.

properties.title: June 2007: More Cryospheric Data and Google Earth
properties.description: One of our latest KML files is included in the Google Earth Outreach Environment and Science Showcase. It includes a Sea Ice Index animation, glacier photograph pairs, and an Antarctic ice shelf break-up animation.

properties.title: June 2007: Special Libraries Association (SLA) presentations
properties.description:
The Special Libraries Association conference in Denver had a session on "Resources for the International Polar Year" at which Ruth Duerr spoke on Discovery and Access of Historic Literature from the IPYs (DAHLI). Duerr and NSIDC archivist and librarian Allaina Howard lead the project, which is partially supported by the NOAA Climate Database Modernization Program. Howard presented a paper on Tracking Climate Change in the 21st Century: Supporting Research with Historic Photographs and Google Earth. Former Vice
 President Al Gore opened the conference, highlighting importance of special libraries.

properties.title: June 2007: NOAA@NSIDC GeoRSS Feed Launched
properties.description: The NOAA at NSIDC project manager Lisa Ballagh presented a paper on the new NOAA@NSIDC GeoRSS feed at The Fifth International Symposium on Digital Earth.

properties.title: June 2007: Nordic Seas ice edge data set released, 1750 through 2002
properties.description: The data set title is March through August Ice Edge Positions in the Nordic Seas, 1750-2002. The data are distributed via FTP in ASCII, JPEG and shapefile format.

properties.title: April 2007: Historic film released
properties.description: Featuring recently-discovered historical footage of CU student alpine hikes in the Front Range mountains, this silent color film provides a unique glimpse into the mountaineering lifestyle and familiar landscapes of the past. Watch students in the Mountain Recreation Department from 1938 to 1942 hike, climb, and camp in the Indian Peaks and nearby Rocky Mountain National Park.  To order the ten dollar DVD, please contact NSIDC User Services (nsidc@nsidc.org).

properties.title: March 2007: Animation of Sea Ice Index on Google Earth released
properties.description: The sea ice animation shows images from the Sea Ice Index in Google Earth.

properties.title: Nov. 2006: Operational Ice Chart Data for Research Released
properties.description: The National Ice Center Sea Ice Charts and Climatologies in Gridded Format cover 1972-2004 with weekly or biweekly charts and climatologies in 25 km EASE-Grid. Documentation on NIC charting procedures is included.
